intro: Stenogyne rugosa var. mollis, commonly known as the soft-hairy stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
